intro: Isostigma cordobense, commonly known as the Cordoba bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
